name: YouTube Automation - Full Video Production (5x Weekly)

nodes.name: Schedule Trigger (5x Week)
nodes.notes: Runs Mon, Tue, Thu, Fri, Sat at 9 AM

nodes.name: Find Trending Topics (US)
nodes.notes: Discover trending topics in the United States

nodes.name: Research YouTube Trends (US)
nodes.notes: Check what's popular on YouTube in US

parameters.bodyParametersJson:
={
  "contents": [{
    "parts": [{
      "text": "Write an engaging 1,900-word YouTube script for a 10-12 minute video about {{$json['topic']}}. Target audience: US viewers aged 18-45. Tone: Conversational, friendly, and natural - like talking to a friend over coffee. Use American English, US cultural references, and relatable examples.

Script Requirements:
- Start with a powerful hook (first 10 seconds)
- Use casual, conversational language (contractions like 'you're', 'we'll', 'it's')
- Include US-specific examples and references
- Add natural transitions between sections
- Use rhetorical questions to engage viewers
- Include 2-3 light jokes or humorous observations
- Add conversational fillers naturally (like 'you know', 'I mean', 'basically')
- End with a strong call-to-action

Structure:
[HOOK - 30 sec / 75 words] - Start with a question or surprising fact
[INTRO - 1 min / 150 words] - Casual welcome, preview content
[MAIN CONTENT - 8 min / 1,200 words] - 4 sections, each 2 minutes
[EXAMPLES - 1.5 min / 250 words] - Real US-based scenarios
[CTA - 30 sec / 75 words] - Encourage engagement
[OUTRO - 30 sec / 75 words] - Friendly wrap-up

Write the complete script now:"
    }]
  }],
  "generationConfig": {
    "temperature": 0.7,
    "maxOutputTokens": 2500
  }
}

nodes.name: Generate Natural Script (US-Focused)
nodes.notes: Creates conversational script for US audience

nodes.name: Generate Human-Like Voiceover (US Male)
nodes.notes: Voice: Rachel (US Female, Natural) or Adam (US Male, Natural). ID: 21m00Tcm4TlvDq8ikWAM is Rachel - very natural sounding

nodes.name: Alternative: Google TTS (US Neural Voice)
nodes.notes: Backup option - en-US-Neural2-J is very natural sounding. Other options: Neural2-D (female), Neural2-A (male)

parameters.command:
=cd {{$env.TEMP_DIRECTORY}} && 
# Create file list for concatenation
for f in clip_*.mp4; do echo "file '$f'" >> filelist.txt; done

# Concatenate all clips to match audio duration (10-12 min)
ffmpeg -f concat -safe 0 -i filelist.txt -c copy concatenated.mp4

# Get audio duration
AUDIO_DURATION=$(ffprobe -i voiceover.mp3 -show_entries format=duration -v quiet -of csv="p=0")

# Loop video to match audio duration if needed
ffmpeg -stream_loop -1 -i concatenated.mp4 -i voiceover.mp3 \
  -filter_complex "[0:v]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=1920:1080[v];[1:a]volume=1.0[a]" \
  -map "[v]" -map "[a]" -c:v libx264 -preset medium -crf 23 -c:a aac -b:a 128k \
  -t $AUDIO_DURATION -shortest base_video.mp4

# Add background music (lower volume)
ffmpeg -i base_video.mp4 -i background_music.mp3 \
  -filter_complex "[1:a]volume=0.15[a1];[0:a][a1]amix=inputs=2:duration=first[a]" \
  -map 0:v -map "[a]" -c:v copy -c:a aac -b:a 128k video_with_music.mp4

# Add text overlays and transitions
ffmpeg -i video_with_music.mp4 \
  -vf "drawtext=fontfile=/usr/share/fonts/truetype/dejavu/DejaVuSans-Bold.ttf:text='{{$json["topic"]}}':fontcolor=white:fontsize=60:box=1:boxcolor=black@0.5:boxborderw=5:x=(w-text_w)/2:y=50:enable='between(t,0,5)',\
       fade=t=in:st=0:d=1,fade=t=out:st=DURATION-1:d=1" \
  -c:a copy final_video.mp4

echo "Video created successfully at final_video.mp4"

nodes.name: Assemble Final Video (10-12 min)
nodes.notes: Create final video with all elements

parameters.pythonCode:
from PIL import Image, ImageDraw, ImageFont, ImageFilter
import requests
from io import BytesIO
import textwrap

# Configuration for US audience
title = input_data['topic'][:60]  # YouTube title limit
background_url = "https://source.unsplash.com/1280x720/?technology,modern"

# Download background
response = requests.get(background_url)
img = Image.open(BytesIO(response.content))
img = img.resize((1280, 720), Image.Resampling.LANCZOS)

# Apply slight blur for background
blurred = img.filter(ImageFilter.GaussianBlur(3))

# Create dark gradient overlay for text readability
overlay = Image.new('RGBA', img.size, (0, 0, 0, 0))
draw_overlay = ImageDraw.Draw(overlay)
for i in range(720):
    alpha = int(100 + (i / 720) * 80)  # Gradient from semi-transparent to more opaque
    draw_overlay.rectangle([(0, i), (1280, i+1)], fill=(0, 0, 0, alpha))

img = Image.alpha_composite(blurred.convert('RGBA'), overlay)

# Add text
draw = ImageDraw.Draw(img)

# Try to load a bold font (common on most systems)
try:
    title_font = ImageFont.truetype("/usr/share/fonts/truetype/dejavu/DejaVuSans-Bold.ttf", 90)
    subtitle_font = ImageFont.truetype("/usr/share/fonts/truetype/dejavu/DejaVuSans.ttf", 40)
except:
    title_font = ImageFont.load_default()
    subtitle_font = ImageFont.load_default()

# Word wrap title for better display
wrapped_title = textwrap.fill(title, width=20)

# Add title with shadow effect (US style - bold and eye-catching)
for offset in [(2,2), (-2,2), (2,-2), (-2,-2)]:
    draw.multiline_text(
        (640 + offset[0], 300 + offset[1]), 
        wrapped_title, 
        font=title_font, 
        fill='black', 
        anchor='mm',
        align='center'
    )

# Main title in white
draw.multiline_text(
    (640, 300), 
    wrapped_title, 
    font=title_font, 
    fill='white', 
    anchor='mm',
    align='center'
)

# Add engaging subtitle
subtitle = "WATCH NOW!"
draw.text(
    (640, 500), 
    subtitle, 
    font=subtitle_font, 
    fill='#FF0000',  # YouTube red
    anchor='mm'
)

# Add accent elements (modern US YouTube style)
draw.rectangle([(40, 600), (240, 620)], fill='#FF0000')  # Red accent bar

# Save thumbnail
output_path = '/tmp/thumbnail.jpg'
img.convert('RGB').save(output_path, 'JPEG', quality=95, optimize=True)

return {'thumbnail_path': output_path}

nodes.name: Generate SEO Metadata (US-Optimized)
nodes.notes: Creates metadata optimized for US search

parameters.command:
=# Verify final video
ffprobe -v error -show_entries format=duration -of default=noprint_wrappers=1:nokey=1 {{$env.TEMP_DIRECTORY}}/final_video.mp4

# Check if duration is between 600-720 seconds (10-12 minutes)
DURATION=$(ffprobe -v error -show_entries format=duration -of default=noprint_wrappers=1:nokey=1 {{$env.TEMP_DIRECTORY}}/final_video.mp4)

if (( $(echo "$DURATION < 600" | bc -l) )); then
  echo "ERROR: Video too short: ${DURATION}s"
  exit 1
elif (( $(echo "$DURATION > 720" | bc -l) )); then
  echo "ERROR: Video too long: ${DURATION}s"
  exit 1
else
  echo "SUCCESS: Video duration ${DURATION}s is within 10-12 minute range"
  
  # Move to output directory
  mv {{$env.TEMP_DIRECTORY}}/final_video.mp4 {{$env.VIDEO_DIRECTORY}}/video_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S).mp4
  echo "Video ready for upload"
fi

parameters.subject: =YouTube Video Uploaded: {{$json['title']}}

parameters.command:
=# Cleanup temporary files
rm -f {{$env.TEMP_DIRECTORY}}/clip_*.mp4
rm -f {{$env.TEMP_DIRECTORY}}/filelist.txt
rm -f {{$env.TEMP_DIRECTORY}}/concatenated.mp4
rm -f {{$env.TEMP_DIRECTORY}}/base_video.mp4
rm -f {{$env.TEMP_DIRECTORY}}/video_with_music.mp4
rm -f {{$env.TEMP_DIRECTORY}}/voiceover.mp3

echo "Cleanup complete. Ready for next video generation."
